meanings.definition: A taxonomic category ranking below a genus and above a species.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use subgenera to group similar species together.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied different subgenera of plants in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The subgenera at the zoo had a meeting to discuss their classification.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the subgenera act as bridges between genera.
meanings.sent5: Learning about subgenera helps us understand the relationships between different organisms.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various subgenera of ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent2: Collectors often seek out rare subgenera to add to their collections.
meanings.sent3: At the auction, the subgenera of paintings fetched high prices.
meanings.sent4: The library had a section dedicated to different subgenera of books.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the subgenera of fossils can reveal the history of life on Earth.
